required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Eovist vs. Dotarem Healthy Volunteer MRI
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Blinded, Placebo-controlled Crossover Study Assessing Association Between Gadolinium-based Contrast Agent Administration and Transient Dyspnea/Arterial Phase Motion Artifact

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate changes in volunteer breath-holding capacity in response to gadoxetate disodium (Eovist) administration, compared with saline, and gadoterate dimeglumine (Dotarem). Healthy volunteers will be recruited from three study sites. These subjects will be given three, blinded, randomized injections while undergoing an MRI of their liver and holding their breath. During the scan, the subjects' oxygen saturation and heart rate will be closely monitored. Following the scan, the subjects will complete a questionnaire regarding the breath hold.

primary_outcome.measure: Subject breath hold capacity, as measured by number of seconds a subject can hold his/her breath
primary_outcome.time_frame: following contrast administration, up to 5 minutes

primary_outcome.measure: Subject-reported dyspnea, a measured by questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: following contrast administration, up to 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, following contrast administration, up to 5 minutes
baseline, following contrast administration, up to 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of motion artifacts at arterial phase imaging
secondary_outcome.time_frame: following contrast administration, up to 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of motion artifacts at arterial phase imaging, measured on a 1-5 scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: following contrast administration, up to 5 minutes

arm_group.description: While in the MRI scanner, the subject will receive a clinical dose of Eovist, Dotarem, or normal saline. Each subject will receive all three, in random order, blinded to which agent is received in a given instance.

While in the MRI scanner, the subject will receive a clinical dose of Eovist, Dotarem, or normal saline. Each subject will receive all three, in random order, blinded to which agent is received in a given instance.

While in the MRI scanner, the subject will receive a clinical dose of Eovist, Dotarem, or normal saline. Each subject will receive all three, in random order, blinded to which agent is received in a given instance.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- normal renal function (serum eGFR >60)
Exclusion Criteria:
- renal impairment
- allergy to gadolinium-based contrast
- metallic implanted devices
- claustrophobia
- pregnant and lactating females
